intro: Ferula kelifi, commonly known as the Kashmiri ferula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and feathery leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer, and it is often found in rocky and arid environments. Ferula kelifi is also valued for its medicinal properties, with its resin used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic effects.
